intro: Chaerophyllum cicutaria subsp. villarsii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hedge parsley, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, finely divided leaves, and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
